column69: I like soccer and usually watch things like the world cup. I grew up a big sports fan, but as I have moved into my current state in life I don't have as much time. MLS just hasn't gotten on my radar. I have friends who are big soccer fans and I know MLS is a lower-tier, less competitive league. The best players are in Europe and other leagues. I am sure MLS games are exciting and competitive and still quality soccer, but for someone like me the lack of sustained national attention, the sort of second tier billing etc matter for how much I see MLS and how much time I am going to carve out to watch it

column69: Of all the main sports, I like soccer best. Before the pandemic I regularly went to a pub that supported the local mens and womens soccer teams, in Oregon and the games were on the big screen there. I enjoyed playing soccer in school, because Im much better with my feet than with throwing anything. Without a nearby pub that does this since they closed during the pandemic and never opened again, I dont have a social reason to watch.
